# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in G# (Shape: E)

## Description

The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is a four-note arpeggio made up of the root, minor third, perfect fifth, and major seventh of the scale. For the G# Minor Major 7th arpeggio in the shape of E, the notes would be G# (root), B (minor third), D# (perfect fifth), and F# (major seventh).

## Musical Flavor and Genre

The Minor Major 7th arpeggio has a mysterious and jazzy sound due to the dissonant interval between the minor third and major seventh. It adds tension and interest to the music, making it a popular choice in jazz, fusion, and neo-soul genres. This arpeggio can convey a sense of sophistication or melancholy, depending on how it's used.

1. *"So What"* by Miles Davis - This jazz standard prominently features Minor Major 7th arpeggios in the improvisational sections.
   
2. *"Spain"* by Chick Corea - This fusion jazz piece incorporates Minor Major 7th arpeggios in various sections, showcasing their versatility and unique sound.
   
3. *"Tell Me a Bedtime Story"* by Herbie Hancock - This neo-soul track uses Minor Major 7th arpeggios to create a dreamy and atmospheric vibe throughout the composition.
